intro: Rhynchotheca integrifolia, commonly known as the smooth leafed rhynchotheca, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its simple, entire leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often resembling a raceme. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions and thrives in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
